Description: Ostracon, section (two fragments) of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing an order for payment.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.144)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87658) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87658)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 178 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
